title: Bad Bunny - DtMf (DeBÍ TiRAR MáS FOToS)
titleTranslation: Bad Bunny - I Should Have Taken More Photos

thumbnail.generation_prompt: Bad Bunny style, San Juan Puerto Rico sunset, nostalgic summer vibe, palm trees, ocean, warm colors, reggaeton mood.

tags.name: Grammar
tags.description: Gerunds, past tense, colloquial tú, Caribbean Spanish

tags.name: Vocabulary
tags.description: Slang, Puerto Rican Spanish, shortened forms, music and feelings

tags.name: Themes
tags.description: Nostalgia, regret, missing someone, photos and memories, Puerto Rico

content.text: Otro sunset bonito que veo en San Juan
content.translation: Another beautiful sunset I see in San Juan
detailedTranslation: sunset — English loan word, same meaning (beautiful sunset)
San Juan — capital of Puerto Rico

content.text: Disfrutando de todas esas cosas que extrañan los que se van
content.translation: Enjoying all those things that those who leave miss
detailedTranslation: Disfrutando — enjoying; gerund of disfrutar
extrañan — they miss; infinitive extrañar (los que se van = those who leave)

content.text: Disfrutando de noche' de esas que ya no se dan
content.translation: Enjoying nights like those that don't happen anymore
detailedTranslation: noche' — shortened for noches (dropped 's' at end, common in Caribbean/colloquial speech)
se dan — they happen; darse = to occur, to happen
ya no se dan — they don't happen anymore; repetition for emphasis

content.text: Pero queriendo volver a la última vez
content.translation: But wanting to go back to the last time
detailedTranslation: queriendo — wanting; gerund of querer
volver a — to go back to

content.text: Que a los ojos te miré
content.translation: When I looked at you in the eyes
detailedTranslation: te miré — I looked at you; infinitive mirar, pretérito
a los ojos — in(to) the eyes (looking someone in the eyes)

content.text: Y contarte las cosas que no te conté (Te parece' a mi crush, jaja)
content.translation: And tell you the things I didn't tell you (You look like my crush, haha)
detailedTranslation: contarte — to tell you; infinitive contar + te
conté — I told; contar, pretérito
Te parece' — you look like; parecer (shortened: pareces → parece')
crush — English loan; person you have a crush on
jaja — haha (Spanish onomatopoeia for laughing)

content.text: Y tirarte la' foto' que no te tiré (Acho, jura'o te ves bien linda, déjame tirarte una foto)
content.translation: And take the photos of you that I didn't take (Hey man, I swear you look really pretty, let me take a photo of you)
detailedTranslation: tirarte la' foto' — to take (you) the photos; tirar fotos = to take photos (Caribbean/colloquial)
la' — shortened for las (dropped 's')
foto' — shortened for fotos
tiré — I took; tirar, pretérito
Acho — Puerto Rican slang: dude, man, hey (friendly)
jura'o — shortened for jurao/jurado = I swear (jura'o = jurado, colloquial)
tirarte una foto — to take a photo of you

content.text: Ey, tengo el pecho pela'o, me dio una matá'
content.translation: Hey, I have my chest bare / my heart broken, it gave me a heart attack
detailedTranslation: pecho pela'o — bare chest; pela'o = pelado (shortened, -ado → -a'o in Caribbean slang)
matá' — shortened for matada; here = like a 'kill' / heart attack, slang for strong emotion or pain

content.translation: My heart giving me kicks / pounding
detailedTranslation: patá' — shortened for patadas (kicks); darme patadas = to pound (heart), to give me kicks

content.translation: Tell me, baby, where are you?
detailedTranslation: baby — English, term of endearment
tú está' — you are; está' = estás (dropped 's')
¿dónde tú está'? — Caribbean word order: where you at? (standard: ¿dónde estás tú?)

content.text: Pa' llegarle con RoRo, Julito, Krystal
content.translation: To get to you with RoRo, Julito, Krystal (friends' names)
detailedTranslation: Pa' — shortened for Para (to, in order to)
llegarle — to get to you; llegar + le (Caribbean 'you')
RoRo, Julito, Krystal — names of people / crew

content.text: Roig, Edgar, Seba, Óscar, Darnell y Big Jay, tocando batá
content.translation: Roig, Edgar, Seba, Óscar, Darnell and Big Jay, playing batá
detailedTranslation: tocando — playing; gerund of tocar
batá — Afro-Caribbean drums (batá drums), used in Puerto Rican music

content.translation: Today we left the street destroyed / lit
detailedTranslation: dejamo' — we left; shortened for dejamos
'esbaratá — shortened for esbaratada (destroyed, messed up; here = we tore it up / had a great time)

content.text: Y sería cabrón que tú me toque' el güiro
content.translation: And it would be crazy / messed up if you play the güiro on me
detailedTranslation: cabrón — literally 'big goat'; slang: badass, crazy, intense (depends on context)
toque' — you play; shortened for toques (subjunctive of tocar)
güiro — percussion instrument (gourd), typical in Puerto Rican and Caribbean music)

content.text: Yo veo tu nombre y me salen suspiro'
content.translation: I see your name and I let out sighs
detailedTranslation: suspiro' — shortened for suspiros (sighs)
me salen — they come out (of me); salir

content.text: No sé si son petardo' o si son tiro'
content.translation: I don't know if they're firecrackers or if they're shots
detailedTranslation: petardo' — shortened for petardos (firecrackers; or slang for something lame)
tiro' — shortened for tiros (shots, gunshots; or 'hits' like hits of emotion)

content.translation: My white girl / my light one, perico, my kilo
detailedTranslation: blanquita — affectionate: my light-skinned one, my girl (diminutive of blanca)
perico — literally parakeet; slang: cocaine (here could be term of endearment or drug reference depending on interpretation)
kilo — kilo; can be drug slang or just 'my weight' / my person

content.text: Yo estoy en PR, tranquilo, pero
detailedTranslation: PR — Puerto Rico (abbreviation)
tranquilo — calm, chillin'; here: I'm good / relaxed

sunset.explanation: English loan word; same meaning. Common in Caribbean and urban Spanish.

noche'.explanation: Shortened form: final 's' dropped and written with apostrophe. Very common in Puerto Rican and Caribbean Spanish in song and speech.

la'.explanation: Shortened for 'las'. Same dropping of final 's' as noche', foto', etc.

foto'.explanation: Shortened for 'fotos'. Tirar fotos = to take photos (Caribbean/colloquial).

parece'.explanation: Shortened for 'pareces' (you look like). Te parece' a mi crush = You look like my crush.

crush.explanation: English loan: person you have a romantic crush on.

acho.explanation: Puerto Rican slang. Friendly interjection, like 'hey' or 'man'. Used a lot in casual speech.

jura'o.explanation: Shortened/colloquial for 'jurado'. Jura'o te ves bien = I swear you look good.

pela'o.explanation: Shortened form: -ado → -a'o in Caribbean Spanish. Pecho pela'o = bare chest (or emotionally exposed).

matá'.explanation: Shortened for 'matada'. Here: 'me dio una matá'' = it hit me like a kill / gave me a heart attack (strong emotion).

patá'.explanation: Shortened for 'patadas'. El corazón dándome patá' = my heart giving me kicks (pounding).

baby.explanation: English; term of endearment, same as in English.

está'.explanation: Shortened for 'estás'. ¿Dónde tú está'? = Where are you? (Caribbean word order.)

pa'.explanation: Shortened for 'para'. Very common in speech and lyrics (pa' qué, pa' llegar, etc.).

batá.explanation: Afro-Caribbean drums, used in Puerto Rican and Cuban music. Often in plural: los batá.

dejamo'.explanation: Shortened for 'dejamos'. La calle la dejamo' = we left the street (in a state).

esbaratá.explanation: Shortened for 'esbaratada'. Dejar algo 'esbaratá' = to leave it destroyed / lit (we tore it up).

cabrón.explanation: Slang; literally 'big goat'. Can mean tough, crazy, or (in other contexts) insult. Here: 'sería cabrón' = it would be crazy/intense.

toque'.explanation: Shortened for 'toques' (subjunctive of tocar). Que tú me toque' el güiro = that you play the güiro on me.

güiro.explanation: Percussion instrument (gourd with ridges), typical in Puerto Rican and Caribbean music.

suspiro'.explanation: Shortened for 'suspiros'. Me salen suspiro' = I let out sighs.

petardo'.explanation: Shortened for 'petardos'. Can also be slang for something lame. Here: literal or metaphorical bangs.

tiro'.explanation: Shortened for 'tiros'. Can mean gunshots or emotional 'hits'.

blanquita.explanation: Affectionate; diminutive of blanca. Mi blanquita = my white girl / my light-skinned one (term of endearment).

perico.explanation: Literally parakeet. In slang often means cocaine. In song context can be term of endearment or double meaning.

kilo.explanation: Kilo. In drug slang can mean a kilo of drugs; in affectionate context can mean 'my weight' / my person.

PR.explanation: Abbreviation for Puerto Rico. Yo estoy en PR = I'm in Puerto Rico.
